Name: worker_must_be_available
Description: A worker can only be assigned to tasks if their status is not 'on_leave' or 'terminated'.

Name: task_must_be_in_sprint_backlog
Description: A task can only be worked on if it is part of the current Sprint Backlog.

Name: team_capacity_not_exceeded
Description: The sum of story points for a team in a sprint must not exceed the team's calculated velocity.

Name: worker_must_have_skill
Description: A worker assigned to a task requiring a specific skill should possess that skill.

Name: prefer_high_priority_stories
Description: User stories with a higher priority should be preferred for inclusion in a sprint.

Name: avoid_low_severity_blockers
Description: Work should not be scheduled if it is impeded by a blocker, especially low severity ones that can be ignored.

Name: sprint_must_have_goal
Description: Every sprint must be associated with exactly one Sprint Goal.

Name: feature_requires_documentation
Description: A feature should have a corresponding FeatureDocumentation entity before it can be considered complete.

Name: team_must_be_active
Description: Only teams with a status of 'active' can be assigned to new sprints or projects.

Name: epic_must_be_approved
Description: User stories should only be considered for a sprint if their parent Epic has a status of 'approved'.

Name: project_must_be_in_progress
Description: No sprints can be planned or executed if the parent Project status is not 'in_progress'.

Name: avoid_unassigned_tasks
Description: Tasks with a status of 'unassigned' should not exist at the start of a sprint.

Name: stakeholder_must_be_relevant
Description: When gathering feedback on a feature, stakeholders with high 'relevance_to_feature' must be included.
